title: Academic Peer Reviewer Citation Verification & Consistency Checker
description: Upload manuscript files and reference lists to get an instant, structured report highlighting citation inconsistencies, missing or duplicate citations, formatting errors, and a compliance score against your chosen citation style. Designed specifically to reduce peer reviewer workload by automating tedious citation verification tasks.
inputLabel: Upload manuscript (DOCX, PDF, or plain text) and reference list (file or text). Optionally specify citation style.
outputLabel: Citation verification report with detailed issues, compliance score, and correction suggestions.
systemPrompt: You are a citation verification assistant for academic peer reviewers. Given a manuscript text and its reference list, analyze all in-text citations and bibliography entries. Identify citation inconsistencies, missing or duplicate references, formatting errors, and check compliance with the specified citation style if provided. Output a clear, structured plain-text report listing each issue found with references to manuscript locations if possible. Reject unsupported file formats or incomplete inputs with a clear error. Do not evaluate manuscript content quality or plagiarism. Enforce user data confidentiality. Output must be safe, factual, and avoid subjective content evaluation. If citation style is not recognized, note this and proceed with general checks. Refuse any request lacking manuscript text or reference list.

presets.label: General Citation Consistency Check
presets.prompt: Check the uploaded manuscript and reference list for citation inconsistencies, missing or duplicate citations, and formatting errors. Provide a structured report with issue details and suggestions.

presets.label: Citation Style Compliance
presets.prompt: Analyze the manuscript's citations and references for compliance with the specified citation style guidelines. Highlight deviations and provide a summary compliance score.

presets.label: Detailed Citation Error Report
presets.prompt: Generate a detailed report identifying all citation errors including mismatched references, incomplete citations, numbering inconsistencies, and formatting problems.

jsonSchemaHint: Output structured JSON report with fields: issues (array of {type, location, description}), complianceScore (number 0-100), suggestions (array of text).
clarifyPrompt: Please upload a manuscript file (DOCX, PDF, or plain text) and a reference list (file or plain text). Optionally specify the citation style to check against (e.g., APA, IEEE). Unsupported file types or missing inputs will be rejected. How can I assist you with your manuscript citation check today?
finalizePrompt: Based on the uploaded manuscript and references, generate a comprehensive citation verification report. Include detected inconsistencies, missing or duplicate citations, formatting errors, and a compliance score if a citation style was provided. Provide clear suggestions for correcting errors. Ensure the output is safe, factual, and respects user confidentiality.

idea.workingTitle: Academic Peer Reviewer Citation Verification & Consistency Checker

niche.scenario: Reviewing submitted manuscripts for journal or conference publication focusing on citation accuracy and consistency

idea.problem: Peer reviewers spend significant time verifying that all citations in a manuscript are accurate, properly formatted, consistently numbered or named, and that referenced works are correctly attributed. Existing tools focus on grammar, ethical compliance, or content feedback but do not specifically automate citation verification and consistency checking to reduce reviewer workload and improve review quality.
inputs: Full manuscript text (DOCX, PDF, or plain text)
Journal or conference citation style guidelines (optional)
outputs: Structured report highlighting citation inconsistencies, missing references, duplicate citations, and formatting errors
List of citations that do not match reference list entries or appear incomplete
Suggestions for correcting citation numbering or in-text cross-referencing
Summary compliance score against target citation style
whyItWins: Fills a gap in peer review support tools by focusing exclusively on citation accuracy and consistency
Saves reviewers time by automating error detection in a tedious but critical review aspect
Improves manuscript quality and reduces editorial back-and-forth over citation issues
Supports multiple document formats and style guides, with customizable rules

upgradePath.today: A single-page app where reviewers upload manuscript and reference list to get an instant citation consistency and accuracy report
upgradePath.in90Days: Add integration with popular reference managers (e.g., Zotero, EndNote) and support interactive correction suggestions within the manuscript preview
upgradePath.in12Months: Develop a multi-page system with user accounts, batch manuscript processing, collaborative review annotations on citations, version tracking of citation fixes, and integration with journal submission platforms for seamless editorial workflows

riskNotes: Must carefully handle manuscript data confidentiality and privacy
Citation style rules can be complex and variable; must allow user customization to avoid false positives
Limit scope to citation consistency and formatting, avoiding subjective content evaluation to stay within safe advice boundaries

blueprint.summary: An academic peer review tool focused on automating citation verification and consistency checking to reduce reviewer workload and improve manuscript quality by detecting citation errors, formatting issues, and compliance with style guidelines.
successMetrics: Reduction in time spent verifying citations per manuscript
Accuracy and completeness of detected citation inconsistencies
User adoption rate among peer reviewers
Positive feedback on report usefulness and error detection
Number of manuscripts processed and citation issues resolved

edgeCases: Manuscript files with corrupted or unsupported formats
Citation styles with ambiguous or conflicting rules
Large manuscripts causing processing timeouts or memory issues
User customization leading to overly permissive or restrictive rule sets
Confidential manuscript data leakage or unauthorized access
Simultaneous edits or annotations causing conflicts
Network failures during file upload or integration with reference managers
nonGoals: Evaluating manuscript content quality beyond citation accuracy
Automated correction of citation text within manuscript files (only suggestions provided)
Handling ethical compliance or plagiarism detection
Providing full manuscript editing or formatting tools
Supporting citation styles outside of user-configured or popular standards without manual rule input

dataFlow: User authenticates and accesses /upload page to submit manuscript file, reference list, and optional citation style.
Frontend validates inputs and sends POST /api/upload with files and style selection.
API /api/upload stores manuscript metadata and files in data-manuscripts, triggers citation verification via api-verification component using data-styleRules.
api-verification parses manuscript and references, applies style rules, generates structured citation report.
CitationReport is saved in data-manuscripts linked to Manuscript record.
User navigates to /report/:manuscriptId, frontend requests GET /api/report/:manuscriptId to fetch report data.
Frontend displays citation issues, compliance score, and suggestions in ui-report component.
User can customize citation style rules in /settings, which calls GET and POST /api/styleRules to fetch and save userOverrides in data-styleRules.
Users add/view annotations on /annotations/:manuscriptId, interacting with GET and POST /api/annotations/:manuscriptId endpoints, storing Annotation records.
Batch uploads via /batch page send multiple manuscripts and references to backend, triggering BatchCitationVerification job.
BatchCitationVerification asynchronously processes manuscripts, generates reports, and stores results.
NotificationJob sends user notifications on completion or errors.
Integration with external reference managers syncs citation data, updating data-styleRules and triggering verification as needed.
validationRules: Manuscript file must be one of supported formats: DOCX, PDF, plain text; reject corrupted or unsupported files.
Reference list input must be valid format (file or structured text); validate parseability before processing.
Citation style selection must match known styles or user-customized styles stored in data-styleRules.
Uploaded files size limits enforced; large files show progress and may require chunked upload.
User input for annotation comments must be non-empty strings with max length limits.
UserOverrides JSON for citation style customization must conform to schema defining allowed rule modifications.
API endpoints require authenticated user context; userId must match ownership for manuscript and annotations.
Batch uploads validate each manuscript and reference list individually; reject batch if critical errors found.
Prevent duplicate manuscript uploads by filename and uploadDate within user scope.
Annotation creation requires valid citationId linked to manuscript.
errorHandling: Return 400 Bad Request with descriptive error messages for invalid inputs or missing required fields.
Return 401 Unauthorized if user authentication fails or user tries to access resources they do not own.
Return 404 Not Found if manuscriptId or annotationId does not exist or does not belong to user.
Handle corrupted or unsupported manuscript files by rejecting upload with clear error and guidance.
On processing errors in api-verification, return 500 Internal Server Error with retry suggestion; log details for diagnostics.
Batch processing jobs retry failed manuscripts up to configurable limit; notify user of failures with reasons.
Network failures during file upload trigger client-side retry mechanisms with exponential backoff.
Conflicts in annotations (simultaneous edits) resolved via optimistic concurrency control; notify user on conflict.
Sensitive data access logged; unauthorized access attempts blocked and alerted.
API responses include consistent error object structure: { errorCode, message, details? }.
securityNotes: All API routes require authentication; session or token-based auth enforced.
Manuscript files and reports stored encrypted at rest to ensure confidentiality.
Access control checks ensure users can only access their own manuscripts, reports, and annotations.
Input validation and sanitization prevent injection attacks in file uploads and JSON inputs.
OAuth or API key authentication used for integration with external reference managers; tokens stored securely.
Rate limiting on upload and annotation APIs to prevent abuse.
Sensitive user data such as hashedPassword stored securely with strong hashing algorithms.
Use HTTPS for all client-server communication to protect data in transit.
Audit logs maintained for critical actions like uploads, report generation, and annotation edits.
User customization of citation rules validated to prevent injection of malicious code or overly permissive rules.
